title: Jekyll & Hyde
content:
Hello.

I am trying to find out what typeface would have been used in the original 1886 copy of Jekyll and Hyde.  
I have been to the British library and looked at the original and made a photocopy.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709020522im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Jekyll_and_Hyde_Title_3624.jpg)

Any help would be much appreciated.

Thank you.

James

 [‹ DIN-like sans serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709020522/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44624 "Go to previous forum topic") [Which serif and sans serif fonts? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709020522/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44621 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jamesaallen

comments.content:
An excellent digital equivalent is Scotch Modern from Shinntype.

[http://www.shinntype.com/scotch.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709020522/http:/www.shinntype.com/scotch.html "http://www.shinntype.com/scotch.html")
I wonder when Nick’s beautiful Scotch Modern is going to be available? Anyone know?

Thanks very much for your help marcox.  
Would love a copy of that, will have to keep my eyes pealed for a release.

thanks again.
